name: sophistically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to sophistry (= clever but untrue arguments), or that uses sophistry in order to deceive people: There are those who sophistically argue that we don't live in a democracy but in a republic. She was sophistically aware that by her actions she was ensuring one more meeting with him.
More examplesFewer examplesThe active elimination of potential disagreement is sophistically being made to promote the state's own interests.Political economy sophistically conceals the opposite side of the argument.The belief has been sophistically opposed by some.
